definition: gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots

sentences.english: And she passed a crime scene where somebody was shot on the street.
sentences.chinese: 目睹了街道边的一起枪击案。

sentences.english: They say he used a military-style assault rifle to carry out the shooting spree.
sentences.chinese: 他们称，他使用一支军用突击步枪实施了此次枪击案。

sentences.english: This is an issue dramatizing the fact that after the shooting incidence took place, the government did not provide all the information.
sentences.chinese: 这正显示在枪击案发生后，政府没有提供所有的资讯。

sentences.english: She was one of the victims of a shooting last Saturday in Tucson, Arizona.
sentences.chinese: 她是上周六亚利桑那州图桑市枪击案的受害者之一。

sentences.english: University officials said there were four suspects in the shooting and one was in custody.
sentences.chinese: 校方官员称枪击案有四名嫌疑人，其中一人已被羁押。

sentences.english: Churchgoers are remembering the victims of the Northern Illinois University shooting rampage.
sentences.chinese: 教徒们在纪念北伊利诺大学枪击案的受害者。

sentences.english: This was after the Columbine High School shootings in Colorado.
sentences.chinese: 写文章的时间就处在卡罗拉多高校枪击案之后。

sentences.english: The three victims from the Newark school shootings have been buried.
sentences.chinese: 三名纽沃克校园枪击案的受害者昨天入土为安了。

definition: terrorist attack (abbr. for 恐怖襲擊|恐怖袭击[kong3 bu4 xi2 ji1])
to shoot with a gun/shooting incident
alleged killer (or attacker)/suspect in a case of violent crime
Virginia, US state/abbr. for 弗吉尼亞州|弗吉尼亚州[Fu2 ji2 ni2 ya4 zhou1]
